alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 15 at 11:16AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting St. Tammany, Hancock and Pearl River Counties. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa, Pearl River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY, DECEMBER 24... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Pearl River. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday, December 24. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Secondary roads to the river and throughout Honey Island Swamp are inundated. Property in the vicinity of the gage is flooded threatening about 20 homes along the left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 05/09/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
